citation.article-title: Cryptanaerobacter phenolicus gen. nov., sp. nov., an anaerobe that transforms phenol into benzoate via 4-hydroxybenzoate
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Cryptanaerobacter [Crypt.an.ae′ro.bac.ter. Gr. adj. kryptos hidden; Gr. pref. an not; Gr. n. aer air; anaero not (living) in air; N.L. masc. n. bacter rod; N.L. masc. n. Cryptanaerobacter an anaerobic rod that is hidden within the consortium].
Gram-positive, anaerobic bacteria in the form of short rods; electron-dense.
Sulphate, thiosulphate, nitrate, nitrite, FeCl3, fumarate and arsenate are not used as electron acceptors.
Sulphite is not normally used even though stimulation of growth and 4-OHB transformation activity at low concentrations (up to 2 mM) has been noted under certain culture conditions.
The type species is Cryptanaerobacter phenolicus.
